snippet: The N.Y.P.D.’s Clean Halls program stops residents without identification in their own buildings. A lawsuit should force the department to re-examine its policy.
abstract: Editorial supports New York Civil Liberties Union lawsuit against the New York Police Department's Clean Halls program, which allows police to stop and search residents without identification in their own buildings; holds that program, which has largely focused on minority neighborhoods, is stoking anger and distrust among black and Hispanic New Yorkers; expresses hope that civil rights lawsuits will force the city to examine this invasive policy.
lead_paragraph: The N.Y.P.D.’s Clean Halls program stops residents without identification in their own buildings. A lawsuit should force the department to re-examine its policy.
